did.abstract: Letter of March 5, 1801, to an unidentified addressee. Hazard refers first to some personal business and to the maintenance of someone (perhaps a relative) in a mental hospital. He then describes briefly the response among Democrats in Philadelphia to the election of Jefferson as president of the U.S. Also mentioned are attitudes toward Governor Thomas McKean (1734-1817) of Pennsylvania and the war in Europe.
